job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: MUST HAVES:-Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 5+ Python software development for composition and modularity, debugging and following tracebacks-Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Strong stats background and concepts including hypothesis testing, correlation, R squared, P-value-Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Experience with Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Pytorch -Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Tensorflow functional API, deep learning-Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Mathematics of machine learning- linear algebra, multivariable calculus -Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â SQL querying -Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Hyperparameter optimization, regularizing regression models PLUSSES:-Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Masters or PhD- HIGHLY preferred!! -Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Ecommerce experience Â DAY TO DAY:Â Â Â A company is looking for a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to sit remotely within the US.Â We follow industry standard practices for managing, collaboration, deployment and testing.Â We deploy and interact with resources on AWS.Â Responsibilities include:â¢ Analyze large data sets by quantifying the data quality, identifying particular patterns, and visualizing results â¢ Understand business problems and identify the right data sets and ML/Statistical approach to produce the desired outcomes â¢ Adapt to account for changes and be able to propose alternative approaches â¢ Ideate and develop analytics and modeling solutions cross-functionally to build customized, long-term, and sustainable solutions â¢ Provide critical thought leadership and enhance organizational capabilities â¢ Own machine learning pipelines end-to-end â¢ Write production-grade machine learning code using standard engineering practices and deploy models to production â¢ Improve codebase and lead/participate in code reviews with Research Scientists and Data Scientists â¢ Help non-engineers develop their engineering skills â¢ Mentor junior team members and contribute to a culture where everyone is valued
